original: Adell, Arthur Gotthard, kyrkoherde, Söderköping, f. 25/3/94 i Örtomta, östergötl. 1., av folksk :lär. Axel A. o. Emilia Jonsson. G. 20 m. fil. mag. Mahn Ribbing. Barn: Erik f. 20, löjtn., Sthlm, Birgitta 21, d. 46, Maria 23, d. 31, Öved 25, fil. stud., Upps., Lars 29, stud., Norrköp. — Stud:ex. i Linköp. 11, teol. kand. i Upps. 19, prästv. i Linköp. s. å., stud. kyrkomusik i Tyskl., Schvy^eiz o. Engl. 22, 26 o. 28. V. kommin. i Hägerstad o. Op-peby 20, ständ. adj. i Alotala 22, kommin. i Vretakloster o. Stjärnorp 23, v. kommin. i Storkyrkan i Sthlm 29, domkyrkovicepastor i Lund 30, kyr-koh. i Söderköp. o. Skönberga förs. sed. 38. Sekr. i Sv.es kyrkosångs-förb. centr :råd 25-30, ordf. i Laurentius Petrisällsk. sed. 41. Skr.: Nya Testam. på svenska 1526 (36), Primärövers. i Nya Testam. 1526 (38), Mus’:-handskr. fr. Högs o. Bjuråkers kyrkor (41), Evangel. tidegärd (tilils. m. K. Peters), red. o. ansv. utg. av Tidskr. f. Kyrkomusik o. Sv. Gudstjämstliv sfed. 26, av Sv. Gudstjänstliv sed. 42. Adéll, Bengt-Ingvar, civilingenjör, Linköping, f. 27/9/11 i Jönköp. av stadsing. Einar A, o. Yngva Olsson. G. 41 m. Elga Widberg. Barn: Margit f. 43, Wilhelm 44. — Stud:ex. v. Jönköp. h. a. 1. 31, civ:ing:ex. v. KTH (elektrotekn.) 37. Bitr. patenting. v. Luxor Radio A-B i Motala 36, patenting. v. Sv. Aeroplan A-B i Linköp. sed. 04, inneh. B.-L Adéll,s Patentbyrå i Linköp. sed. 46. Led. av Sv. tekn:-fören. sed. 37. Adéll, Einar Birger, isitadsingenjör, Jönköping, f. 8/12/82 i Broddtorp, Skarab. 1., av handl. Johan Emil A. o. Birgitta Andersson. G. 10 m. Yngva Olsson. Barn: Bengt-Ingvar, Ber-til-Einar, Inger Yngva Maria o. Kerstin Eljena Birgitta. — Utex. fr. CTH 03. Prakt, å arkitektkont. o. v. Gbgs stads byggn :kont., stadsing. i Jönköp. sed. 08, mätn :man i Jönköp. o. Grän- na. Insp. f. yrkessk., led. av Jönköp. civ :försv :nd, landst:kapt. RVO, LandstiSM.
translated:
Adell, Arthur Gotthard, clergyman, Söderköping, b. 25/3/94 in Örtomta, Östergötland, son of elementary school teacher Axel A. and Emilia Jonsson. Married to Mahn Ribbing, a graduate with a degree in philosophy. Children: Erik, born in 1920, a lieutenant in Stockholm; Birgitta, born in 1921, deceased in 1946; Maria, born in 1923, deceased in 1931; Öved, born in 1925, a graduate student in Uppsala; Lars, born in 1929, a student in Norrköping. Education: graduated from high school in Linköping in 1911, received a Bachelor's degree in Theology from Uppsala University in 1919, ordained as a priest in Linköping the same year, studied church music in Germany, Switzerland and England in 1922, 1926, and 1928 respectively. Worked as a deputy minister in Hägerstad and Oppeby in 1920, standing adjutant in Alotala in 1922, minister in Vreta Kloster and Stjärnorp in 1923, assistant minister in Stockholm Cathedral in 1929, cathedral chaplain in Lund in 1930, and as a clergyman in Söderköping and Skönberga parishes since 1938. Secretary of the Swedish Church Choral Society's central council from 1925-1930, chairman of the Laurentius Petri Society since 1941. Author and editor of several works, including a translation of the New Testament in Swedish in 1936 and a primary translation of the New Testament in 1938, music manuscripts from Högs and Bjuråkers churches in 1941, and The Evangelical Rite (with K. Peters). Editor and responsible publisher of the Journal for Church Music and Swedish Worship Life from 1926 and of Swedish Worship Life since 1942. 

Adell, Bengt-Ingvar, Civil Engineer, Linköping, b. 27/9/11 in Jönköping, son of city engineer Einar A. and Yngva Olsson. Married to Elga Widberg in 1941. Children: Margit, born in 1943, and Wilhelm, born in 1944. Completed high school in Jönköping in 1931 and earned a degree in electrical engineering from KTH in 1937. Worked as a patent engineer for Luxor Radio A-B in Motala in 1936 and for Swedish Aeroplan A-B in Linköping since 1940, and owns B.-L Adell's Patent Office in Linköping since 1946. Member of the Swedish Association of Engineers since 1937.

Adell, Einar Birger, City Engineer, Jönköping, b. 8/12/82 in Broddtorp, Skaraborg, son of merchant Johan Emil A. and Birgitta Andersson. Married to Yngva Olsson in 1910. Children: Bengt-Ingvar, Bertil-Einar, Inger Yngva Maria, and Kerstin Eljena Birgitta. Graduated from CTH in 1903. Worked as an architectural assistant and at Gothenburg's City Building Council, and became a city engineer in Jönköping in 1908. Also worked as a surveyor in Jönköping and Gränna. Inspection for vocational schools, member of the Jönköping Civil Defense Committee, awarded with RVO, and a county captain.

education.description: Ordained as a priest in Linköping

memberOf.name: Swedish Church Choral Society's Central Council
